conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for chapter 21 of the main campaign.
I want to hear more stories today, Uranus!
You never tire of them, do you, child?
I've made all manner of new discoveries because of your wisdom. Please, you must teach me more!
Very well, my pactbound child. I will confer my knowledge upon you once more.
I look forward to seeing what you do with it and how it evolves through you.
I will not disappoint you!
The Radiant City, Chanzelia Palace Guest Room
Hmm... I must have fallen asleep What a nostalgic dream that was.
*cough* *cough*
Mmm. Blood. Taking into account my ragged breathing, chest pain, and discoloration of skin, I estimate my lungs to be 30 percent decayed.
(So this is the end that awaits the puppet of the Progenitor, is it?)
(Though really I should be happy I've lasted as long as I have. The Progenitor did say the wyrmscale made me a solid vessel.)
How painfully ironic. With my disease now cured, I still can't escape the grim clutches of death.
It was avarice that led to the resurrection of the Progenitor, and this must be my punishment for it.
Knock knock, dear brother.
Well, you look...poorly.
Merely tired from the long journey here.
Thankfully, this bedroom you provided afforded me some much needed rest.
Well, that's good to hear—but I doubt a soft bed will be enough to heal the most fundamental problem with your body.
And that would be?
Clearly the aftereffects of being used by the Progenitor are enacting a terrible toll.
I really cannot hide anything from you. Alas, you are correct: my body is beginning to shut down.
I knew it...
Such sadness ill suits you, my sister. I brought this on myself, so keep your sympathy for others who have need of it.
What will you do now?
Go to the Halidom, most likely.
Why there?
I hear tell that our younger brother has called researchers of all sorts to his side.
Perhaps our combined talents can find a way to beat back the Progenitor's threat.
THAT'S what you plan to do in your weakened condition? You really ought to take better care of yourself.
It is precisely BECAUSE of my weakened condition that I must go; I doubt I'll live long enough to see the final battle.
I want to atone for my actions, so if I can leave behind research that helps in the war to come, I aim to do so.
So this is atonement, then?
My fear of death caused me to fall under the Progenitor's sway, which is why we now find ourselves in this unholy mess.
The world should not have to pay the price for my own egotism.
Harsh, but fair. As royalty, we must each take responsibility for our own actions.
Though speaking of our family line, what happened to your pactwyrm?
Uranus?
I'm certain you remember how the Other was able to use Zodiark while he possessed our father.
I figured the same was true of the Progenitor and Uranus, but have heard nothing of his fate.
He is dead—killed by my own hands.
Oh no...
You know I was experimenting on how to alter a dragon through black mana, yes? Well, Uranus... He was my test subject.
And as it was my first experiment, I did not hold back.
He proved unable to withstand the black mana.
But Uranus was no mere pactwyrm— he was your mentor and friend! In fact, I remember him teaching you a great many things.
Indeed, I learned more from him than I ever could have gleaned from any book. His mind was...fascinating.
I also heard you once saved his life!
Indeed I did...
(I thought I heard something groaning over here...)
Graaaagh...
(A dragon! And what is this next to it?)
Do not trouble yourself with me, human... My body is being ravaged by an... unknown poison...
Hmm... I recognize this fragment from a book I read about ancient weaponry. Have you somehow awakened an ancient relic?
I reduced it to dust... But I did not expect it to contain a poison capable of harming a mighty dragon... GRAAAAAGH!
Keep still, dragon; I know how to craft an antidote for this poison.
Wait here. I will bring it to you.
What...is your name, human?
Phares, the second scion of Alberia.
...After you nursed him back to health, the two of you became pactbound, yes?
You gave him life only to take it away in some mad experiment? Such cruelty is unthinkable, Brother.
To say I intentionally healed him is not quite correct—I merely wanted to test if what my book said was true.
I have always viewed medical treatment as just another kind of experiment— though I'm certain Uranus resented the way I toyed with his life.
Perhaps you did not mean to harm him. Perhaps the Progenitor was wielding some manner of terrible influence that drove you to such ends.
Who can say? It is true that my body and mind were influenced by the Progenitor...
But even so, I am not free of blame; I have ever been unable to control the curiosity that rages inside of me.
Additionally, my heart has harbored a kind of resentment against dragons ever since I was diagnosed with wyrmscale.
Oh, Phares...
That is why I distanced myself from Uranus, and harbored neither guilt nor sadness over the way I abused him.
I am an incredibly selfish man—so selfish that I destroyed my own mentor simply to fulfill my own twisted desires.
All of that to say Uranus will not be a problem for us in the coming battle.
Yes, well, I should take my leave soon. I wish you good health, Sister.
Oh, my dear brother...
I've finally arrived... *cough*
*pant* *pant* I can...still make it.... I still have time.
(My greatest sin was making light of life, and I will gladly accept any punishment for that.)
(But I cannot stand aside and let the world bear what is rightfully my own suffering. I must make haste!)
This is the first time I've met many of you, but now is not the time for pleasantries.
Our great battle against the Progenitor is nigh, yet there remains much we do not understand about our foe.
I care not what field of research you choose or what methods you use; I ask  only that you share aught which might be of assistance in laying low our great foe.
Will you do this thing, my new friends? Will you lend me your aid?
Of course!
(I just need a little more time... I must hold out until the last battle!)
Oh my, yes! Look at the logs of this ritual! Perhaps it has something to do with the Progenitor!
A record from 500 years ago, is it? Hmm, it doesn't use the name ＂Progenitor,＂ but it does indeed appear to be referring to them with a codename.
Can you decipher it, Kleimann?
WHEE HEE HEE HA HA HA HOO! I haven't devoted my life to the study of ritual magic for nothing, you know!
Good. Let us hope there is something useful there at the day's end.
That ritual is heretical, and thus forbidden. As royalty, are you certain you wish to delve further into such subjects?
One cannot find the truth without exploring the realm of the taboo. Surely this is a concept you are familiar with?
If our work here leads to a strategy against the Progenitor, I care not how heretical the means are to that end.
You're fortunate my companion isn't around to hear you say that.
Well then, I suppose I shall do as I please. It isn't every day that one is able to throw off the shackles of convention to such a degree, after all!
You summoned us hence with cause, good sir, yet I fear I know little in the matter of physic or inquest.
All I ask is that you try. I would like you to learn what you can about the Progenitor from the perspective of the Sandreach.
Aye, the history of my people is long and longer still, and there may yet be clues about that scapegrace hidden amongst our many annals.
And while you're blowing dust off books or whatever, I'll wrangle up the other dunefolk and, like, get 'em to help! Girl, we're gonna DO this thing!
I shouldn't be surprised that you could supervise the many...unique types of people here in the Halidom, dearie, and yet I still find myself impressed.
You have been a great help as well, Cassandra.
Well, I brought the results of Sinoa's research. She would have come herself, but the poor thing is still cleaning up the more explosive results of her work.
You have my thanks. Perhaps space-time magic will prove the key to sealing away the Progenitor once and for all.
Forgive me, dearie, but didn't you already have another plan in place for that?
One cannot have enough backup plans when it comes to a battle against the very creator of the world.
Ha! You're clearly the son of that cautious Aurelius, and no mistake! ...Hmm?
S-sorry to interrupt. I just had something I wanted to say to Prince Phares.
There is need for such formalities among we fellows of science.
O-okay...Phares.
You are the mana observer Sophie, yes? What did you need?
Well, I'm not sure if this has anything to do with the Progenitor, but I've noticed something about your own mana.
Which is?
It's very slight—hardly noticeable unless I really focus—but I sense a strange mana about you that... Well, it isn't yours.
Were you aware of this, Phares?
No. I had no idea.
Er, would you permit me to maybe look into this some more? It might be having some kind of effect on your body.
While I appreciate your concern, further research is unnecessary.
I imagine my mana simply changed as a result of how the Progenitor used me.
We lack the time to look into anything other than what will help us in this fight, so my strange mana will need to wait.
I...I see.
Nicolas has written a detailed report, and Althemia has some rather perceptive points to make as well...
Hmm? This is from Sophie. I specifically told that woman not to bother looking into my mana situation, and yet...
(Observations on the Effects on Mana Following Possession by the Progenitor.)
＂I suspect that Phares's mana has become corrupted and changed by the influence of the Progenitor, who uses black mana.＂
＂However, as far as I can observe, this seems to be causing no ill effects. In fact, the mana appears to be protecting him.＂
＂I hypothesize that this unknown mana may be a defense mechanism of his own mana.＂ ...An interesting theory.
Unknown mana resting within me...hmm...
(I could test whether it is acting as a defense mechanism by infusing myself with black mana! No, but before that—)
Enter!
Sophie? Is everything all right?
It seemed like you were still awake, so I brought you some tea. Er...is this a good time?
Perfect, in fact; I am in need of a break.
I'm glad to hear... Oh! That's my report!
And a fascinating report it is.
I'm sorry! I know you told me we didn't have the time to look into it, but I just couldn't stop thinking about it!
I know all too well what it's like when an idea worms its way into one's mind.
And your report has piqued my curiosity about this mysterious mana as well.
Scholars such as ourselves are drawn to the unknown. When a mystery arises, we cannot stop until we have uncovered all there is to know about it.
Then why don't we look into it?
I know it doesn't have much to do with the fight ahead, but it DOES have something to do with you.
Mana can carry people's thoughts and feelings, so maybe yours is actually trying to tell you something!
But more than that, if this is something you want to know, then it's something you SHOULD know.
...I can't say I am entirely uninterested.
Then...?
But as I said before, we lack the time for research that will do nothing save sating my own curiosity.
Could you really just let this go?
What?
The way I see it, the fact we lack the time means we should look into it more.
With so few days left to us, we should use them to fulfill the things we truly want.
I didn't...
I observed your mana, so I know the state it's in. Your mana is stagnant, as if it's being restrained by something.
Mana is something that is meant to be as free as the wind. Your current situation can't be good for you.
I believe the reason your mana has stagnated is internal—that the effect is psychological.
Is that so?
So please, listen to the voice of your heart.
And take care of yourself, all right? Mana disruptions can affect the body.
I appreciate the warning.
The voice of my heart...
(I haven't been free since the moment the wyrmscale began ravaging my body.)
(What would I have done if I hadn't been afraid of death coming at any moment? If I had always been...healthy?)
(I'd likely I have thrown myself wholeheartedly into my research, longing to find what truths this world may hide.)
Heh. Why am I thinking of my own wants at a time like this?
I don't have the time to ruminate about freedom. Nothing can change this.
Right now, I must formulate what direction we'll take in tomorrow's research.
(But I still am grateful for your consideration, Sophie.)
What in the name of pennywhistles are you talking about?!
I believe I made myself clear.
I will be leaving the task of overseeing all Progenitor research at the Halidom to you.
You will be able to utilize such information in this fight ahead better than I ever could.
But you're still HERE. Why pass the responsibility on to me now?
You know very well why.
...So it's that bad?
It is.
Just wait a few more days, dearie. I'll find a way to heal you.
No need. I have given up on fighting death.
Well, you may have given up, but I won't just sit back on my cozy davenport and wait for one of his heirs to die!
It is well, Cassandra.
It is NOT well, you maddening man.
You will be undergoing treatment from Chanzelia's medical corps, and that is the end of the discussion.
Chelle?!
Did you really expect me to do nothing after hearing how your life hangs by the thinnest of threads?
I've gathered the world's finest doctors from North Grastaea, South Grastaea, Taiwu, and Hinomoto to aid you.
It is no exaggeration to say this team represents a gathering of the entire world's medical expertise.
I remain as impressed as ever by your diplomatic prowess, dear sister.
Oh, but we have more than just doctors: my research division has been hard at work creating the most technologically advanced medical facilities ever seen.
Come with me to Chanzelia, Phares. Get treatment. Heal thyself.
While I am very much intrigued by this medical corps you've assembled, I would have you use it in the battle to come instead of squandering it on me.
Did it ever occur to your stubborn brain that you might be NEEDED in that battle?
I will have you aboard the Gran Fiore if I have to drag you there by force.
You are being childish.
Oh, but this is not childishness, Brother. It is a royal decree.
Your knowledge and wisdom will likely prove necessary in the times to come.
No matter how strong an army, it will always lose without a sound strategy. I'm keeping you alive so we might win.
I see no reason why you cannot lead our army just as well as myself.
Because you have all the knowledge you've accumulated in all your research, plus memories from when the Progenitor was using you as his vessel.
There are none better suited as a tactician for this fight than you.
A ruler should be able to tell how best to utilize their own life, and you are nothing if not a ruler, Phares.
Your skill at masking emotion with logic has greatly improved, little sister.
That sounds like projection to me, big brother.
I do not argue based on emotion; I merely state objective facts.
Were it not for the Progenitor, I would be dead long since. The fact I still draw breath is an aberration, nothing more.
Behold our current predicament if you doubt me! This is what happened the last time I tried to fight death.
I'm going to ask you something, and I need an honest answer.
Do you truly believe that dying a useless death serves as satisfactory atonement?
Is surrendering yourself to death honestly what you want?
I would hear your answer, Brother.
Prince Phares!
Not now, Leif!
Let him speak, Chelle.
My apologies for the interruption, but His Highness has just received an urgent message from Valkaheim.
From Leonidas?
Did something happen?
Countless fiends and unidentified dragons have descended upon Valkaheim.
The dragons are cloaked in massive amounts of black mana, and powerful though Prince Leonidas may be, this fell horde threatens to overwhelm him.
Ah, I see. He seeks to hold them at bay in the hopes I know a way to deal with the black mana that powers them.
Chelle, take me to the Gran Fiore. We must make for Valkaheim! *cough*
Phares!
Phares!
*pant* *pant* Merely a flare-up—do not trouble yourselves overmuch. Now please, take me to Valkaheim with all speed!
Going to the front lines as you are now would be suicide!
Who do you think more necessary for the upcoming battle: Leonidas or myself?
If I refuse to help Leonidas and the worst comes to pass, our ability to stand against the Progenitor would drastically weaken.
This fate must be avoided at all costs. We NEED Leonidas in the battle to come.
You said yourself that a ruler is meant to know how to utilize their own life, yes?
Then give the order, Chelle!
...Very well.
Leif, gather reinforcements to send to Valkaheim. Cassandra, I leave the research team to you.
Yes, Your Highness!
You've grown into a most strong woman, Chelle, but your kind heart is the same as it has ever been.
...Do you think that's the sort of praise I want to hear? Hmph.
Blast! It's just one after the other!
I came as quickly as I could, Leonidas.
And yet you still kept me waiting. But where is our sister? You were aboard the Gran Fiore, were you not?
She remained behind to manage the defense of Chanzelia. If the worst comes to pass and we fall here, the Radiant City will be in danger as well.
I called you here to AVOID the worst coming to pass.
Ah, yes. You wish me to solve your little black mana situation, do you not?
Just lend me your wit, if naught else. We cannot permit them to violate this land any more than they already have!
Of course. Let us deal with them at once!
Leave the fiends to us!
Very good. Now then...
The black mana is so thick it cloaks the dragon itself. That's even more than I expected.
We cannot even determine if our attacks are hitting home or not.
Can Mars still fight?
Of course. Though he suffers some effects of the black mana, it is nothing that cannot be overcome.
You are too reckless, Brother.
And you are the last person I wish to hear such an assessment from.
Fair enough. Well then, if Mars can move, we still have a chance of victory.
I will deal with the black mana. Thanks to the Progenitor, I've come to understand how to handle it.
ROOOOOOAR!
He approaches!
There!
His lance hit the mark! No, wait...
Nnngh... Haaah!
No! The fool is using the lance to absorb the black mana!
(Idiocy! A human being cannot possibly withstand... Ah, but this is Phares we speak of; I'm certain he has already taken such things into consideration.)
Mars! Rain hellfire upon this dragon while the black mana is weakened!
Full alchemical burst!
ROOOOAR!
*pant* *pant* Did...did we do it?
Indeed we did. The dragon was incinerated along with all of the remaining black mana.
But I must say, it's very unlike you to have devised such a suicidal plan.
It was merely...the best plan for the current situation. *cough* *hack*
Here. Take my shoulder. I doubt you can move more than a few steps as you are.
I never thought the day might come when you would lend me a shoulder, Brother.
Silence. I'm the one who called you out here, and this is the least I can... Hmm?
*growl*
Blast! The tenacious beast yet stands!
But the black mana has mostly dispersed. Wait...is that...?!
Uranus!
Your pactwyrm?!
But...that's impossible! Uranus is dead!
Explain yourself, Phares.
Uranus perished during my experiments to create a black-mana dragon.
To think you would use him so... Well, if that be the case, why does he stand before us now?
I'm at a loss for answers myself.
GRAAAAAAAAAGH!
By hook or crook, your wyrm has somehow escaped death. I think it is time to give the poor creature a proper funeral.
Now that he's no longer shielded by the black mana, he is no match for us. Come, Mars! Show the power of our pact!
Leonidas!
Die, beast! Full alchemical burst!
GRAAAAAAAAGH!
(Leonidas seems to have the upper hand, yet I can't shake this sensation that something is terribly wrong.)
(Even though Uranus is still standing, I know that attack landed. But how did he even survive in the first place?)
And take care of yourself, all right? Mana disruptions can affect the body.
(Perhaps this is the effect of mana from when Uranus was nearing death...)
(Black mana causes a dragon's negative emotions to grow stronger until they can no longer retain their sanity.)
I have always viewed medical treatment as just another kind of experiment— though I'm certain Uranus resented the way I toyed with his life.
(If the black mana in my experiment reacted to Uranus's feelings of hate at the moment of death...)
(It might have grown powerful enough to infuse his entire body, pulling him back from the brink and starting him on this mad rampage.)
(Yes... Yes, that makes sense.)
But if Uranus lives because of the black mana, it means the reason he was able to stand once more is...
BURN!
LEONIDAS, STOP! DO NOT ATTACK AGAIN!
ALCHEMICAL EXPLOSION!
ROAAAAAAAAR!
What in the blazes...? HNNNGH!
(No! The black mana is getting inside my body!)
ROOOOAR!
(I can't dodge it!)
What?!
Nnngh...
PHARES!
Y-you're alive... Thank goodness... *cough* *hack*
Why did you protect me?
Because...you need to live... more than I...
How can you say this?
We need you...in the battle to come... Now please...leave me here...
Still such talk at once, you fool. Damn, but these wounds run deep...
All is well, Leonidas... I wasn't... long for this world anyway...
I did all that I could...and in the end... I glad I died protecting my dear brother...
I have no regrets... Now...live on...
Phares, no! PHAREEEEES!
I should have died on that day, and I cursed fate for its cruelty in bringing me back once more.
I could not understand why I alone was forced to live with such a terrible affliction.
So I refused to accept that fate, and instead stained my hands by bringing about the resurrection of the Progenitor.
And it would seem I was a selfish person to the very end, for despite the atrocities I committed, I allowed myself to feel joy.
Joy that I could once again speak to my family, and joy that I could live as myself once more.
But I won't turn from death this time.
I gave my life to save my beloved family, and I have no regrets.
Enough of this madness! You always wanted to live more than any of us!
Leonidas...?
How dare you claim to have no regrets, you maddening fool!
Your will to live was so strong it drove you to embrace the Progenitor itself!
So I will not stand by and watch you welcome death now. Fight, my brother! Dig your claws into the earth and FIGHT!
So please, listen to the voice of your heart.
Is surrendering yourself to death honestly what you want?
(Of course not...)
(All I've ever wished for is...)
...to live. To live! I WANT TO LIVE!
Then don't you dare give up now! Fight against your destiny and put some good back into this world!
Heh. Well said, Brother.
ROOOOOAR!
Tch! Back for more, eh?
Leonidas? Bring Uranus to me.
You look to use yourself as bait, then?
In a sense. As he goes to feast on me, I will absorb his remaining black mana. In that moment, you will finish him off.
And please believe me when I say I have no intention of dying in this fight!
Very well. Mars, to me!
OVER HERE, FELL BEAST!
ROOOOOAR!
Nnngh!
Now, Uranus... Now I will finally free you from the black mana I so cruelly forced you to bear! HAAAAAAAH!
ROOOOOOARGH!
DO IT, LEONIDAS!
Your end draws nigh, dragon! Haaaah!
ROAAAAAAARGH!
*pant* *pant* That...should do it...
You have my thanks.
I am merely happy to be of use. *cough*
You are a terrible liar.
What makes you say such?
You boasted about having no intention of dying here.
And I live, as you can clearly see.
Your body has reached its limit. Hasn't it?
Perhaps...but I still have no regrets... for I finally lived in a way of MY choosing.
But...I really don't want to die...
If only...I had more time...
Hmm? What is this mana?
Where am I?
It has been some time, my pactbearer.
Uranus! How are you...?
Now is the time for me to repay my debt.
You cannot possibly be referring to the single time I saved your life?!
How can you possibly owe ME when I used you in my horrible experiments?!
Yes, that you did. And what of it?
I...I don't understand.
Had you not saved me all those years ago, I'd not have survived long enough to endure your experiments.
Then were you resigned to your fate?
I accumulated much knowledge in my many long years. But humans? Humans are always creating new things—many of which far surpass my own wisdom.
So I was fascinated to see what a human who was granted my wisdom could create, and regret none of our time together.
We both carried the same ideals, then.
Indeed we did, human—it is why I formed a pact with you in the first place.
This pact ended up being quite useful, for even though you were on death's door, I was able to provide you with my mana.
So the mana lying within me...
You must live, Phares—live and further the human pursuit of knowledge to your own heart's content.
And even though my body is lost, I will become your mana and see how humans grow and evolve alongside you.
Uranus, wait!
Being with you gave me so much joy, so please...accept this gift.
URANUS!
Ah! Where am I?!
Finally awake, are we?
Chelle...? Am I really alive?
Unless I have suddenly gained the ability to speak with the dead, then yes.
Leonidas...
Once Uranus's mana surrounded you, your wounds healed themselves.
Imagine my surprise—and, frankly disappointment—to haul my entire medical corps all this way only to find them wholly unnecessary!
In addition to your wounds healing, the decayed parts of your body have recovered as well.
We suspect there are hardly any aftereffects from your ordeal with the Progenitor left at all.
Uranus saved my life...
(So the mana resting within me was Uranus's all along...)
(And the reason my body didn't decay faster was because it kept me alive.)
What will you do now, Phares?
Now that you no longer have to worry about your health, I mean.
To begin with, I will seek to rectify all of my wrongdoings.
Your ＂wrongdoings?＂ Phares, I want you to listen to me, and listen well:
It is human nature to cling to life. It is not some kind of sin.
I know. And thank you—both of you.
I never thought I would return here.
(Now I know that Uranus's mana rests within me.)
(It is an odd twist of fate indeed to be saved by a dragon after my dragonblood caused me to suffer so...)
Ah, the breeze feels very nice. It reminds me how Sophie said that mana is meant to be as free as the wind.
I will not waste the freedom you have granted me, Uranus.
I will defeat the Progenitor and protect this world!
